Package fr.cnrs.iees.identity

Interface IdentityScope

All Known Implementing Classes:
IntegerScope, LocalScope, PairLocalScope, ResettableLocalScope, UniversalScope
public interface IdentityScope

A scope over which Identity instances are guaranteed to be unique.

Note: every scope has a unique id over the application scope so that merging items from different scopes is always possible using Identity.universalId().

Author:
Jacques Gignoux - 28 janv. 2019

  • Field Details

    • scopeIds

      static final Set<String> scopeIds
      This field to make sure all scope instances have a different id

  • Method Details

    • id

      String id()
      The scope identifier, unique within the application context. Uniqueness is guaranteed by a static list recording the scope ids at scope instantiation.
      Returns:
      the scope id

    • newId

      Identity newId()

      Makes a new instance of an Identity, unique over this scope.

      NOTE: implementations of this method should never return null.

      Returns:
      a new Identity instance, unique over this scope

    • newId

      default Identity newId​(boolean addToScope, String proposedId)

      Makes a new instance of an Identity, unique over this scope.

      The default implementation ignores the argument.

      NOTE: implementations of this method should never return null.

      WARNING: this method is conceptually flawed and should be refactored soon.

      Parameters:
      addToScope - argument only used in LocalScope (whether the id should be recorded or just checked for uniqueness) [NOTE: one more flaw in the design!]
      proposedId - a base for the id to be computed
      Returns:
      a new Identity instance, unique over this scope

    • newId

      default Identity newId​(boolean addToScope, String... proposedIdComponents)

      Makes a new instance of an Identity, unique over this scope.

      The default implementation ignores the argument.

      NOTE: implementations of this method should never return null.

      WARNING: this method is conceptually flawed and should be refactored soon.

      Parameters:
      addToScope - argument only used in LocalScope (whether the id should be recorded or just checked for uniqueness) [NOTE: one more flaw in the design!]
      proposedIdComponents - a base for the id to be computed (argument only useful in PairLocalScope [NOTE: one more flaw in the design!]
      Returns:
      a new Identity instance, unique over this scope

    • removeId

      void removeId​(String id)

      WARNING: this method is conceptually flawed and should be refactored soon. NEVER use it!

      Parameters:
      id - The id to expunge from the scope.

    • contains

      boolean contains​(String id)

      WARNING: this method is conceptually flawed and should be refactored soon. NEVER use it!

      Parameters:
      id - The id to search for.
      Returns:
      True if the Id exists within the scope, false otherwise.

    • addId

      void addId​(String newId)

      WARNING: this method is conceptually flawed and should be refactored soon. NEVER use it!

      Parameters:
      newId - The id to add.
